titleStmt.title: The Presbyter's antidote choaking himself. Or Stephen Scandrett confuting himself in his erroneous bundle of confusion and absurdities, still'd, An antidote against Quakerism being a brief collection of some of his errors, blasphemies, and self-contradictions. Together with some interlineary notes upon them.
titleStmt.author: Ludgater, Robert, d. 1695.

titleStmt.title: The Presbyter's antidote choaking himself. Or Stephen Scandrett confuting himself in his erroneous bundle of confusion and absurdities, still'd, An antidote against Quakerism being a brief collection of some of his errors, blasphemies, and self-contradictions. Together with some interlineary notes upon them.
titleStmt.author: Ludgater, Robert, d. 1695.

notesStmt.note: Signed at end of text: From some of us concerned in the narrative of the two disputes in Essex, entituled, The glory of Christ's light within expelling darkness; i.e. Robert Ludgater, and others, of Coggeshall, in Essex -- cf. Smith.
In response to Scandrett, Stephen. An antidote against Quakerisme.
Reproduction of the original in the Friends' House Library, London.
